The Node.js code is a module that exports various path-related functionalities from another module located at `'./shared/pathe.1f0a373c.cjs'`. It imports a module called `index`, which likely provides path manipulation functions similar to the Node.js built-in `path` module. The code organizes these functions and re-exports them for use elsewhere.

Here is a possible rewrite of the code:

```javascript
'use strict';

import * as index from './shared/pathe.1f0a373c.cjs';

export const basename = index.basename;
export const delimiter = index.delimiter;
export const dirname = index.dirname;
export const extname = index.extname;
export const format = index.format;
export const isAbsolute = index.isAbsolute;
export const join = index.join;
export const normalize = index.normalize;
export const normalizeString = index.normalizeString;
export const parse = index.parse;
export const relative = index.relative;
export const resolve = index.resolve;
export const sep = index.sep;
export const toNamespacedPath = index.toNamespacedPath;
export default index.path;
```
